intro: Eriocaulon vandaanamense, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers. Native to Southeast Asia, it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and colonize new areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
